item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Zombies’ Big Season 2 Reloaded Addition is a Step in the Right Direction
item.description:
Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Zombies could use a boost of adrenaline, and Season 2 Reloaded might just end up providing it. Following the release of its divisive Tomb map, and continued criticism of Black Ops 6 Zombies’ voice actor situation, public opinion has shifted a bit regarding Treyarch’s latest game. While it was extremely well received at launch, and its post-launch map Citadelle Des Morts was a hit with the community, The Tomb being a letdown for a significant portion of the community means that there is a good deal of pressure on the midseason update and its limited-time mode.

Thus far, Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Zombies fans have had access to two limited-time modes, those being Jingle Hells and Dead Light, Green Light. While the incredibly tough Jingle Hells had its share of fans, as it had a solid gameplay loop and gave a taste of what it would be like if modern Zombies lacked easy-to-acquire armor, the Squid Game -themed mode was significantly less popular. Fortunately, Black Ops 6 ’s upcoming Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles crossover is bringing what seems to be an exciting LTM to Zombies, as it addresses the key flaws with the previous attempts: replayability and rewards.

Why Cowabunga Cranked Is Poised to Be Highly Replayable

Perhaps the biggest thing working in Cowabunga Cranked’s favor is that it is playable on all four of the current Zombies maps. Unlike Jingle Hells, which was restricted to Liberty Falls, and the Citadelle Des Morts-exclusive Dead Light, Green Light, players can play TMNT Cranked on all of Zombies’ currently available arenas. This alone could push players to put more time into Cranked than they did with the other limited time modes, as whenever they get bored of the modified rules on one map, they can simply switch over to another to see how Cranked feels in a different setting.

Another major plus is that players will not have the Black Ops 6 camo grind negatively impacted by Cowabunga Cranked, as they spawn in with their loadouts. This is a welcome change, as Jingle Hells forced camo grinders to use wall weapons or get lucky with a present drop to find the gun they were wishing to work on. Additionally, players do not need to worry about a round limit or forced exfil, which was an approach used for Dead Light, Green Light that caused many to abandon the mode. Main quest Easter eggs will also be enabled, which will undoubtedly be more difficult since players need to keep slaying the undead in between completing all the steps.

Cowabunga Cranked has unique elements besides its kill timer. Pizza power-ups temporarily grant maxed out Black Ops 6 melee weapons and extra health, as well as extra time. Additionally, the Donny’s Time Stopper Field Upgrade gives players the freedom to approach the mode tactically and stop the timer when they think it will help to do so.

Cowabunga Cranked’s Exclusive Calling Cards May Be Its Secret Weapon

While Jingle Hells did let gamers do the main quest Easter eggs on Liberty Falls, it did not provide them with a special reward for completing it, something that dedicated players were disappointed by. Fortunately, just like with the complaints about Mangler spawns and Directed mode camo grinding, Treyarch has clearly listened to the community. For every main quest players manage to finish within Cranked, they will receive a “subtly different” variant of the quest’s calling card. Even if this is just a recolor of the calling card’s artwork, and a different symbol in place of the gold skull that marks early completions, it is still something new for players to chase. Given how hard it will be to complete something like The Tomb’s main quest with an added Cranked timer, the calling card for doing it will undoubtedly be a badge of honor for gamers to show off. This reward, combined with loadouts, multiple maps, and no forced exfil, could make Cowabunga Cranked a massive success.

item.title: Infinity Nikki: How to Get & Craft Winter Flame Outfit
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How to Get Winter Flame Outfit in Infinity Nikki
  • How to Craft Winter Flame Outfit in Infinity Nikki

There are many different ways to get new outfits in Infinity Nikki . Instead of only using Diamonds to wish for new outfits, you can also find new pieces as you adventure around the map, and sometimes craft them on your own through sketches. This allows you to widen your wardrobe and create new outfits.

One of the outfits you can discover while out and about in Miraland is the Winter Flame. This set includes seven pieces, including quite a few different accessories. As each item is found in a completely different spot, it can be difficult to find all of them. Here's how you can get the entire Winter Flame outfit.

How to Get Winter Flame Outfit in Infinity Nikki

Some of the items in the Winter Flame outfit are relatively easy to obtain, only requiring you to visit a shop and purchase the item. However, others will require you to unlock them as a Sketch in the Heart of Infinity , or complete an entire quest. If you are unsure where exactly to get each item, here's what you need to know.

Item Type

Item Name

How to Get

Location

Hair

Clearsky Moon

The sketch can be unlocked in the Heart of Infinity. You can find it just underneath the Purification Outfit.

Top

Crimson Snowstorm

Complete the quest Kindled Inspiration: Warm Protection to receive the sketch.

Shoes

Snowfall Boots

First unlock the Summer Breeze Whim Fragrance by completing the quest, Find Fragrance: Citrus Burst . Then, you can unlock the Snowfall Boots sketch in the Heart of Infinity.

Bottom

Sleek Attire

First, unlock the Unbridled Growth Whim Fragrance in the Heart of Infinity, and then you can unlock Sleek Attire just after it.

Headwear

Pristine Grace

Unlock the Budding Tales Whim Fragrance in the Heart of Infinity, and then you can unlock Pristine Grace afterward.

Gloves

Midnight Moon

Purchase these at Marques Boutique for 15,900 Blings in Florawish.

Earrings

Blazing Scorch

In the bottom right section of the Heart of Infinity, you'll find a section for Styling Potential . You will then eventually be able to unlock the sketch for Blazing Scorch.

How to Craft Winter Flame Outfit in Infinity Nikki

While some items only need to be purchased to complete the Winter Flame outfit, many will need to be crafted. This means you will need to gather certain materials to create the item successfully. Luckily for this outfit, most of the items are incredibly common and easy to source. Here are all the items you will need:

  • 440x Thread of Purity
  • 30x Tangled Ribbon
  • 30x Hollow Knot
  • 20x Tough Leather
  • 20x Brokenheart Patch
  • 16x Bedrock Crystal: Energy
  • 6x Sunny Orchid
  • 1x Blossom Beetle
  • 1x Ambird Feather

How To Get Points In Charity Chip In Monopoly GO

If you want to progress in the Charity Chip In tournament, you should land on your current board's Railroad spaces and complete Bank Heists and Shutdowns. Here's how many points these minigames offer:

Bank Heist

  • Small: Four Points
  • Large: Six Points
  • Bankrupt: Eight Points.

Shutdown

  • Blocked: Two Points
  • Successful: Four Points.

item.title: How to Make the Top Model Dress for Free in Dress to Impress
item.description:
Roblox's Dress to Impress has lots of outfit choices for styling and owning the runway. But for die-hard fans, nothing turns heads like the Top Model Silk Robe—a chic, rosy-pink dress made for the spotlight.

However, getting this stunning outfit means reaching the Top Model rank by earning 25,000 stars , which is quite hard, especially for beginners. But the good news is that if you haven't hit that milestone yet, you can still recreate the look with some fun layering tricks that won't cost in-game currency. This guide will show you how to get the Top Model Dress for free in Dress to Impress .

How To Make The Top Model Dress For Free in Dress to Impress

To make the Top Model dress in Dress To Impress , equip the Halloween Quest Dress, Valentine's Quest Dress, Basic Top, Simple Tube Top, and Tied Top Sleeves, keeping all materials as silk in rosy pink shades. If you don’t have the Halloween outfit, you can swap it with the Winter Quest outfit for a sleeker look—just don’t forget to add its sleeves if you've completed the quest.

Here’s a quick breakdown of all the items, their locations, and other key details.

All Top Model Dress Items

Items Required

Location

Toggle

Material

Color

Halloween Quest Dress (or Winter Quest Dress)

Enter one of the Dressing Pods and equip it from the Reward section.

Type 2

Silk

Rosy Pink (HEX #ff9adc)

Valentine's Quest Dress

Go to one of the Dressing Pods and put it on from the Reward section.

  • Top: Layer
  • Skirt: 3

Silk

Rosy Pink (HEX #ff9adc)

Basic Top

Pick from the Tops shelf next to the shoe area in the non-VIP section.

None

Silk

Rosy Pink (HEX #ff9adc)

Simple Tube Top

Grab it from the Tops shelf in the non-VIP section.

None

Silk

Rosy Pink (HEX #ff9adc)

Tied Top Sleeves

Snag from the right shelf near the shoe area.

None

Silk

  • Sleeves: Rosy Pink (HEX #ff9adc)
  • Fur: Light Pink (HEX #f0b5d5)

Thankfully, all the listed stuff is completely free and can be equipped in seconds, making it easy to recreate the Top Model Silk Rob Dress just in time for the 6-minute competitive round. While the clothes are non-VIP, you'll still need to finish their respective questlines to unlock them. For those who spend most of their time in the free-play server, assembling and saving the outfit in a dressing pod is a great idea. This way, you can quickly wear it again without redesigning it and even show it off in free-play competitions.

item.title: Weird Stardew Valley Glitch Makes Farmer Walk on Water
item.description:
Summary

  • Glitch in Stardew Valley allows farmer to walk on water, getting trapped in the lake.
  • Issue with crab pots causing farmers to phase through them and get stuck on water.
  • NPCs in Stardew Valley also exhibit pathfinding glitches, walking on water or through walls.

A Stardew Valley player has experienced a weird glitch that led to their farmer walking on water. If that weren't odd enough on its own, the Stardew Valley player quickly learned that their farmer was trapped on the small lake they were walking on.

Stardew Valley has many bodies of water in it, and most of them can be fished in. Setting up crab pots to passively capture creatures and items is also a possibility, but fans might want to take some care, as it seems that there's an issue with crab pots that could lead to this particular problem.

A Stardew Valley player going by the name of corus26 shared a video of their strange experience of standing on a lake. The player's farmer can be seen running across a lake on their farm, walking on water like it's on solid ground. According to corus26, they were just trying to check on the crab pots that are seen on the perimeter of the lake, but somehow ended up getting into the lake. While this would probably just be an amusing moment if it were left at that, the player quickly found that they were now stuck in the lake and couldn't get out, even if they tried to access an area with no crab pots. The only way they were able to fix it was by quitting the game and restarting the day, though they also note that they won't go anywhere without a warp totem anymore, just in case this happens again.

Water Walking in Stardew Valley Isn't an Isolated Incident

While many fans were content to just share their amusement and wonder at the scene, others pointed out that something similar had happened to them. It seems that, in rare instances, the farmer can somehow phase through a crab pot when checking it, leading to them being stuck on the body of water they're floating on. Some of those who have gone through this have simply let the day elapse, as once the clock strikes 2 am, Stardew Valley farmers will pass out and wake up the next day in their bed. There are some minor penalties for doing this, but it might be worth it if someone has this issue after a particularly fruitful day.

This isn't the first instance of seeing someone waking on water in Stardew Valley , as NPCs' pathfinding sometimes breaks and leads to them phasing through walls or casually walking across bodies of water. Overall, Stardew Valley has few bugs that are genuinely problematic, as the developer releases patches whenever issues are found. Hopefully, this issue will be patched out in the future, as players typically only want to see Stardew Valley 's ducks on bodies of water, not themselves or NPCs.
